title: Apache Solr to adhere to Apache Project Branding Requirements
description:
The ASF project branding requirements [0] provide guidelines for projects to follow and adhre to.
This is a trivial task, so I'll patch the site and upload it. 

[0] http://www.apache.org/foundation/marks/pmcs.html

comments.author: Lewis John McGibbney
comments.content:
Patch contains trivial update of website documentation so it makes sense. A 'TM' symbol has also been added to main Solr logo as well as title of index.html/mdtext

Thanks

comments.author: Yonik Seeley
comments.content: I'd rather not add TM to the logo... it's not actually required (and the version attached here is blurry in any case).

comments.author: Lewis John McGibbney
comments.content:
Yonik Seeley 
I'd rather not add TM to the logo... it's not actually required
This is not correct. Please see [0]. 
I think it important for a subproject with the exposure and reputation like Solr to adhere to branding requirements just as every other project should. 
If there are branding issues, these should also be included in reports sent to board@ and some effort put in to addressing the issues.
I'll be happy to take another look into the branding requirements if it would be of any help? 

[0] http://www.apache.org/foundation/marks/pmcs.html#graphics

comments.author: Steve Rowe
comments.content: I fixed branding issues on the Lucene and Solr sites over a year ago.
